snippet: Soft-drink officials concede that Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s ban on large sodas is expected to be approved by New York City’s Board of Health on Thursday — for now.
abstract: Soft-drink industry plans to continue campaign against New York City's proposed ban on the sale of large-size sodas, which is expected to be approved by city's Board of Health; industry officials, fearful that stricter limits on sales could incite a national trend, and a long-term erosion of profits, say they will focus on the long run, and may even consider a legal challenge to the restriction.
lead_paragraph: Soft-drink officials concede that Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s ban on large sodas is expected to be approved by New York City’s Board of Health on Thursday — for now.

headline.seo: In Soda Ban, Soft-Drink Industry Braces for a Long Fight
headline.main: In Soda Fight, Industry Focuses on the Long Run
headline.print_headline: In Soda Fight, Industry Focuses on the Long Run
